result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Standard Conditions

11:00 AM Defendant Heather Ann Pfister appeared by phone, in custody.  Attorney Larry J. Lloyd appeared by phone for Heather Ann Pfister.  Attorney Claudia T. Johnson appeared by phone for State of Wisconsin. 
950/Marsy's Law complied with. Atty Lloyd requests telephone or in person contact w/children, Safe Harbor would help facilitate/Jerry is advocate at Safe Harbor. 
State has no objection to 3rd party contact with reasons stated on the record. No one on the conf line call from Safe Harbor. Court amended bond conditions adding to allow what family court order states.
Deft states family case is 20FA144.

10:35 AM Defendant Heather Ann Pfister appeared by phone, in custody.  Attorney Larry J. Lloyd appeared by phone for Heather Ann Pfister.  Attorney Claudia T. Johnson appeared by phone for State of Wisconsin. 
No bond motion on file, Attorney Lloyd set up hearing with JA. State is in compliance with victim rights. There is a bond motion filed in 20CF597- Branch 5 case, Court reviews. Defense requesting cash bond be modified to a signature bond so defendant can admit to a inpatient treatment program(NOVA). Defense would like more information regarding treatment facility. Complied with Marsy's law. Court would like an authorization from Ms.Pfister from wherever she ends up for treatment and a commitment from the facility. Also would like to know transportation information. Court denies bond request at this time, but willing to reconsider if more information provided.
Bail/bond hearing on May 18, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Standard Conditions
Additional Conditions:
No contact directly or indirectly with the party/parties named in the bail bond - contact allowed with children via letter writing through Mr. Pfister.
Not to consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs or possess drug paraphernalia.
Not to be on the premises of any tavern or business whose sole purpose is the sale of alcoholic beverages.  
Not operate any motor vehicles unless reinstated according to law.  
Comply with day reporting requirements.
